name: Describe and continue a sequence given diagrammatically

skills.name: Describe an ascending linear sequence in words
Continue linear sequences expressed as patterns by drawing the next pattern

explanations.A: I think you may have just looked at the first two terms and assumed you would double the number of circles each time. This rule does not work between the second and third terms. Try finding the difference between every adjacent pair to help you spot the pattern.
explanations.B: I think you may have assumed that because we have added on 4 to get from the second to third term, that we would add on 4 again. But this rule does not work between the first and second term. Try finding the difference between every adjacent pair to help you spot the pattern.
explanations.C: The pattern between the terms is +3, then +4, so the next one will be +5. There are 10 circles in pattern 3 so we would expect 15 (10 + 5) circles in pattern 4.
explanations.D: Not quite.Try finding the difference between every adjacent pair to help you spot the pattern.
